description:
Tree Preservation Application At:
9-14 Compton Road, Islington, London, N1 2PA

TPO Reference:
T1 – Sycamore of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
T2 – London Plane of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
T3 – London Plane of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
T4 – Lime of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
T7 – London Plane of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
T8 – London Plane of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
T9 – Lime of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006 
T10 – Cherry of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
T11 – Birch of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006

PO Number:
T090028

Work specifications:
T1 
1 x Sycamore as detailed in the TPO plan of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006
Prune to clear lamp by 2m. Clean out crown by removal of epicomic growth and deadwood.

T2, T3, T7 & T8 
4 x London Planes as detailed in the TPO plan of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006.
Clean out crown by the removal of epicomic growth and deadwood.
T3 only – reduce x1 branch extending over the access to the property by up to 2m.

T4
1 x Lime as detailed in the TPO plan of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006.
Thin crown by up to 15%.
Clean out crown by the removal of epicormic growth and deadwood.
Prune back to give a clearance of up to 4m from the front of the property.

T9
1 x Lime as detailed in the TPO plan of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006.
Clean out crown by the removal of epicormic growth and deadwood.
Prune back to give a clearance of up to 2m from the telephone lines over Compton Road

T10
1 x Cherry as detailed in the TPO plan of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006.
Clean out crown by the removal of epicormic growth and deadwood.
Lift over the footpath to ensure 2.5m clearance.

T11
1 x Birch as detailed in the TPO plan of LBI TPO (NO. 301) 2006.
Crown thin by up to 15%.
Lift over the footpath to ensure 2.5m clearance.
decision_conditions: Under section 1 of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 any person who intentionally injures a wild bird, or damages or destroys the nest of any bird while that nest is in use or being built is guilty of an offence. This means that works to trees with nests in them should be timed to avoid the bird nesting season if possible, generally April to September.
